body:

replies.body:
I recognized who it was right away honestly. She has both her big cape and her big bow and arrow which were her two big defining traits. The only skins that she is missing either of these is Sherwood in which she doesn't have a cape. I guess you might be able to confuse her for Vayne but she really doesn't look anything like Vayne.

Cait on the other hand was known for her long gun and her big hats. The picture you're showing doesn't even look like a gun, imo, and her hat looks like Kha's head was slapped on top of her as a cap it's not big and guady like most of her skins.

Hey there! 

When thinking about what makes a champion identifiable, we think about what their silhouette looks like - a shape that, even out of the corner of your eye, you'd likely be able to tell who it is. For Ashe, it's mainly her giant bow, and secondly, her cape. She's got both of those still in tact for this skin, which is why we still feel like it reads as Ashe.

It does have some really interesting themes to work off of, but it would have to be a lot more armor than cloth, which doesn't really scream Quinn to me, but regardless could look really sweet. 

While I more or less have your attention, and only if it isn't too much of a bother, I'm a high school student approaching graduation by December 2015, and I'm really aiming to get a job at Riot (preferably as a concept artist, I love coming up with new champion concepts and content), especially since I'm just a somewhat short drive from one of the studios. Any tips you have that may be able to help me with? **(If it's too much of a trouble, I understand. Thank you for the reply though!)**

With this armor, it's ONLY the weapon that makes the champion identifiable. This Maurader Ashe may just as well have been Quinn or Vayne with a different weapon. Quinn would at least have Valor appear frequently. Not only that, remember our vantage is somewhat behind/overhead meaning the bow will frequently get covered up to where you can't tell the difference anymore. Even with its size, you'll see the tips perhaps on either end. Quinn's arched stance alone would've made her easier to identify in this armor than Ashe:Vayne. Ashe has enough skins too... what's worse is this means Quinn won't get armor that looks similar because of the overlap. When Ashe has this many skins, she doesn't deserve to take up that look's slot IMHO. Not when it gates champions who deserve a new skin more.
